alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 8:46AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Ulster and northwestern Dutchess Counties through 915 AM EDT... At 846 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Kerhonkson, or near New Paltz, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kingston, New Paltz, Rhinebeck, Hyde Park, Hurley, High Falls, Kerhonkson, Staatsburg, Tillson, Port Ewen, Lloyd, Esopus, Rosendale, Gardiner, Norrie Heights, Maple Hill, Forest Glen, Stone Ridge, Elting Corners and Ireland Corners. People attending Dutchess County Fair should seek safe shelter immediately! This includes Interstate 87 near exit 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess; Western Ulster
